page.title: 01BOUGHTON'S LOCATION
page.content: In our block there are only small villages.We have six different ones they are,Goodnestone,Fostall,Hernhill, part of Dargate,part of Dunkirk and finally most of Boughton-under-Blean. All the villages that have been mentioned are mainly farming villages except Boughton which is a mixture of farming and ribbon development. Boughton is on the busy A2 route between London,Canterbury and Dover, but since 1976 the Bypass has re-routed the heavy traffic around the village.(Please see traffic survey page 8).From Boughton, London is 52 miles away,Dover 23 miles, Canterbury is 5 miles and Faversham 3 miles west. Although Boughton is a farming village,most people work out side of Boughton and live in the village.Farm workers have had their jobs replaced by machinery,except for some pickers.
